p: Dancer et al. showed that vitamin D deficiency is a common problem in patients with ARDS and leads to inflammation in alveolar epithelial cells. They also showed that repletion of vitamin D before esophagectomy was associated with reduced alveolar damage in in vivo measurements [ 117]. Ethnic variations in the vitamin D-binding protein relating to differences in the inflammatory profile and disease severity has been demonstrated in tuberculosis patients [ 118].
